author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Mahila Court here on Monday sentenced to one year imprisonment five persons, including four college students, on the charge of ragging a junior in October 2008.

Special Public Prosecutor R. Sarojini said that the 17-year-old boy from Wayanad in Kerala had joined an engineering college, near Sulur, in September 2008.

“Seven seniors, including Mohammed Safi and Aniz, tried to harass him while he was taking a bath in the hostel on September 17, 2008,” she said. The college placed them under suspension, and later revoked it.

On October 8, Safi and Aniz along with their friends Anand Kumar and Mohan went to the boy’s room, assaulted him using a blade, and made him run on the college ground.

The police registered a case against the accused under section 324 (for voluntarily causing hurt using dangerous weapons or means) read with 34 (acts done by several persons with a common intention) and 506(ii) (criminal intimidation) of The Indian Penal Code and Tamil Nadu Prohibition of Ragging Act.

District Mahila Court judge G. Raja imposed a fine of Rs. 6,000 too on them. The hostel warden Shankar (51) too was sentenced to one year imprisonment. He has to pay a fine of Rs. 5,000.
title: Five get jail term for ragging
